msDesc.head: Homiliary (Paul the Deacon, etc.) and sermons; Germany, 12th century

physDesc.p: Two codicological units, together early or from the outset, the second apparently a supplement to the first.

supportDesc.collation: Not fully collatable due to the tightness of the binding. Quire signatures XV–XVIII and XXII in red span the two main parts (fols. 91r, 99r, 107r, 116r, and 148r), suggesting that the volume was mainly composed of quaternions, of which three are missing at the beginning. One would expect the 15th quaternion to start on the 113th leaf, not the 90th, so about 24 leaves are apparently missing. Et verum
supportDesc.condition: Margins frequently excised, leaves damaged elsewhere by the process of excision, with early repairs in places.

binding.p: Laudian binding. Sewn on six bands, laced into pasteboards covered with polished brown leather, each cover stamped in gilt with the arms of Archbishop Laud, with vestiges of two ties; the spine with most of a paper label inscribed with a title in the 17th-century; the joints and spine repaired.

history.provenance: The book has common provenance, as yet unidentified, with MS. Laud Misc. 465: both have margins excised in an identical manner, with added replacement text (e.g. here fol. 49) and flex punctuation (e.g fols. 106–7).
Archbishop William Laud, with the usual inscription, here dated 1636 (fol. 1r).
history.acquisition: Part of his third donation to the Bodleian, 1639. Former Bodleian shelfmarks: ‘Laud 306’ (front pastedown), ‘Laud. I. 76’ (spine label).

recordHist.source: Description by Peter Kidd and Matthew Holford (June 2021). Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, cols. 241–2 Quarto Catalogue, col. 243 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 61

ref.title: Manuscripts from German-Speaking Lands – A Polonsky Foundation Digitization Project

listBibl.head: Printed descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: S. J. P. van Dijk, Latin Liturgical Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Oxford, vol. 2: Office Books (typescript, 1957), p. 165

msItem.title: Homiliary
msItem.note: Sermons on the gospels for the Temporale, from the Wednesday before Easter to the 24th Sunday after Pentecost (the beginning missing). Mostly from the Homiliary of Paul the Deacon, listed below (=PD) with numbering as in R. Grégoire, Homéliaires liturgiques médiévaux: analyse de manuscrits (Spoleto, 1980), which provides further details of sources and editions.

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Homiliae euangelii
msItem.incipit: Et iterum. Videbitur deus deorum in Syon
msItem.explicit: cooperante ipso mediatore dei et hominum homine Ihesu Christo qui vivit secula seculorum amen

msItem.author: Gregory
msItem.title: Homiliae XL in euangelia
msItem.incipit: Manifestauit se iterum Ihesus
Lectio sancti ęuangelii que modo in auribus uestris
msItem.explicit: ad perfectionem roborat Ihesus Christus dominus noster qui cum patre

msItem.author: Gregory
msItem.title: Hom. in euangelia
msItem.incipit: Maria stabat ad monumentum
Maria Magdalena quę fuerat in ciuitate peccatrix
msItem.explicit: ęterno consolabitur gaudio, qui uiuit et regnat

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Hom. euangelii
msItem.incipit: Undecim discipuli abierunt
Evangelica lectio fratres karissimi quam modo audiuimus et iuxta litteram
msItem.explicit: celestis premia subleuet, in qua uiuit et regnat

msItem.author: Gregory
msItem.title: Hom. in euangelia
msItem.incipit: Una sabbati Maria Magdalena uenit
Fractus longa molestia stomachus
msItem.explicit: ipse quem amamus Ihesus Christus
msItem.note: No. 133 in the version of Paul the Deacon printed in PL 95, which differs from that analysed by Grégoire.

msItem.author: Eusebius Gallicanus
msItem.title: Hom. 12A
msItem.rubric: Sermo beati Augustini de resurrectione domini
msItem.incipit: Exulta celum et in leticia esto terra. Dies iste amplius
msItem.explicit: triumphauit et inferos uicit

msItem.author: Gregory
msItem.title: Hom. in euangelia
msItem.rubric: Dominica Ia post Pascha. Secundum Iohannes.
msItem.incipit: Cum esset sero die illa
Prima lectionis huius euangelicę questio animum pulsat
msItem.explicit: pertingitis, quanto mediatorem
msItem.note: PD II.15; ending at PL 76.1204, just before the end of the sermon.
One sermon, and the bulk of the following item, missing at this point.

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Hom. euangelii
msItem.explicit: remunerator uincencium Ihesus Christus dominus noster qui uiuit

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Hom. euangelii
msItem.incipit: Vado ad eum
Sicut ex lectione ęuangelica fratres karissimi audiuimus dominus et redemptor noster
msItem.explicit: dare consueuit Ihesu Christo domino nostro qui uiuit

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Hom. euangelii
msItem.incipit: Amen amen dico uobis si quid
Potest mouere infirmos auditores
msItem.explicit: de patre adnunciet nobis qui uiuit

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Hom. euangelii
msItem.incipit: Quis uestrum
Rogatus a discipulis saluator
msItem.explicit: ante secula parauit per Ihesum Christum dominum nostrum qui

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: In Iohannis euangelium tractatus
msItem.rubric: In uigilia dominicę ascensionis secundum Iohannem
msItem.incipit: Subleuatis Ihesus oculis
Glorificatum a patre filium
msItem.explicit: non est hic de aliquo quantocius
msItem.note: PD II.25. Breaking off just before the end due to the excision of two (?) leaves after fol. 31.

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Hom. euangelii
msItem.incipit: exemplo confortari qui et ipsi
msItem.explicit: priusquam mundus esset aput patrem, cum quo uiuit

msItem.author: Gregory
msItem.title: Hom. in euangelia
msItem.incipit: Si quis diligit me
Libet fratres karissimi euangelicę lectionis uerba
msItem.explicit: non relinquitur sed datur, per dominum nostrum

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: In Iohannis euangelium tractatus
msItem.incipit: Sic deus dilexit mundum
Quomodo qui intuebantur serpentem eneum a Moyse in heremo non peribant morsibus serpentum
msItem.explicit: quia bona et salubria sunt

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: In Iohannis euangelium tractatus
msItem.incipit: Dixit Ihesus turbis Iudeorum, Amen amen
De illuminato qui natus est cecus
msItem.explicit: ad furandum et occidendum

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: In Iohannis euangelium tractatus
msItem.incipit: Nemo potest uenire ad me
Magna gratię commendatio nemo uenit nisi tractus
msItem.explicit: et deus erat uerbum

msItem.incipit: Conuocatis Ihesus duodecim

Modo cum euangelium legeretur audiuimus quia conuocatis Ihesus duodecim apostolis dedit illis uirtutem et potestatem super omnia demonia et ut languores curarent. Et misit illos predicare regnum dei et sanare infirmos. Fortasse enim nemo crederet hominibus illitteratis
msItem.explicit: fidelis intra in gaudium domini tui, cui est honor
msItem.note: Largely as PL 95.1342D-1347B, serm. 153 in the Paul the Deacon collection there printed, which differs from that analysed by Grégoire.

msItem.author: Ambrose
msItem.title: In Lucam
msItem.incipit: Factum est in una dierum
Et ecce uiri portantes in lecto hominem
msItem.explicit: lepra contaminetur

msItem.author: Ambrose
msItem.title: In Lucam
msItem.incipit: Surgens Ihesu de signagoga
Et in synagoga erat homo habens spiritum inmundum Uide clementiam domini saluatoris
msItem.explicit: sacramentum hoc magnum est ego autem dico in christo et in ęcclesia

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Hom. euangelii
msItem.incipit: Erat homo ex Phariseis
Sicut ex lectione ęuangelica
msItem.explicit: et potestas ante omnia et in omnia secula seculorum amen

msItem.author: Gregory
msItem.title: Hom. in euangelia
msItem.rubric: Dominica prima post Pentecosten secundum Lucam
msItem.incipit: Homo quidam erat diues
In uerbis sacri euangelii fratres karissimi prius sequenda est ueritatis historia et postmodum requirenda spiritualis intelligentia allegorię
msItem.explicit: in uestris mentibus loquatur qui uiuit

msItem.author: Gregory
msItem.title: Hom. in euangelia
msItem.rubric: Dominica ija post Pentecosten secundum Lucam
msItem.incipit: Homo quidem fecit cenam magnam
msItem.rubric: Omelia Gregorii pape de eadem lectione
msItem.incipit: Hoc distare fratres karissimi
msItem.explicit: animore flagramus Ihesum Christum

msItem.author: Gregory
msItem.title: Hom. in euangelia
msItem.incipit: Accesserunt ad Ihesum publicani
Æstivum tempus quod corpori meo
msItem.explicit: factus est iudex noster qui uiuit

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Hom. euangelii
msItem.incipit: Estote misericordes
Hoc loco nobis nichil aliud
msItem.explicit: festucam de oculo fratris

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Serm.
msItem.incipit: Modo cum euangelium legeretur audiuius dominum dicentem, Nolite iudicare
msItem.explicit: salutę conueniant, sui est honor

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Hom. euangelii
msItem.incipit: Cum turbę irruerent
Stagnum Genesaret idem dicunt esse
msItem.explicit: uocantem ac iubentem ut sequerentur

msItem.author: Ambrose
msItem.title: In Lucam
msItem.rubric: Omelia Ambrosii episcopi de eadem lectione
msItem.incipit: Ascendens autem in unam nauim Ubi dominus multis impertiuit
msItem.explicit: uiuificandi habeant potestatem

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: De sermone domini in monte
msItem.incipit: Amen dico uobis nisi habundauerit
Inquit dominus discipulis suis quia nisi Idem non solum illa
msItem.explicit: Beati ergo pauperes spiritu quoniam ipsorum est regnum cęlorum

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: In Marcum
msItem.incipit: Cum multa turba esset
In hac lectione consideranda est
msItem.explicit: se pastor ese cibariis

msItem.author: (Ps.-) Maximus of Turin
msItem.title: Serm. 57 (extract)
msItem.incipit: Ait euangelis in presenti lectione, Cum turba multa esset
msItem.explicit: dono repleti spiritus sancti per dominum nostrum

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Hom. V in Matth. VII.15-21
msItem.incipit: Attendite a falsis
Quod paulo superius spaciosam et latam
msItem.explicit: et cuius sitis. Prestante et adiuuante ipso domino nostro

msItem.author: Jerome
msItem.title: Ep. 121.6
msItem.incipit: Homo quidam erat diues
Quis sit uillicus iniquitatis
msItem.explicit: parce et me

msItem.author: Gregory
msItem.title: Hom. in euangelia
msItem.incipit: Cum appropinquaret dominus Iherusalem
Lectionem breuem sancti euangelii breui si possum sermone
msItem.explicit: de quo loquimur qui uiuit et regnat

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: In Lucam
msItem.rubric: Dominica xj post Pentecosten secundum Lucam
msItem.incipit: Duo homines ascenderunt
Quia parabolam suam dominum
msItem.explicit: districtione pensetur ignoro

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Hom. euangelii
msItem.incipit: Exiens Ihesus de finibus Tiri
Surdus ille et mutus
msItem.explicit: intimare dignabitur Ihesus Christus dominus noster

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: In Lucam
msItem.incipit: Beati oculi qui uident
Non oculi scribarum et Phariseorum
msItem.explicit: subleuanda deuotus operare

msItem.author: Epiphanius
msItem.title: Interpretatio euangeliorum
msItem.incipit: Audiuit uestra dilectio ęuangelio canente in presenti lectione hominem qui inciderat in latrones
msItem.explicit: miserebitur dominus nunc et in omnia secula seculorum amen

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Hom. euangelii
msItem.incipit: Cum iret Ihesus in Iherusalem
Leprosi non absurde intelligi possunt
msItem.explicit: gloriam patri qui est in celis

msItem.incipit: Nemo potest duobus
Nemo potest duobus dominis seruire quia non ualet simul
msItem.explicit: ex habundantia super additur
msItem.note: PD II.75a-b, a confection of Bede Hom. III.14 and Bede In Lucam IV.12, 22-31.

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Hom. euangelii
msItem.incipit: Ibat Ihesus in ciuitatem
Naim cuiutas est Galileę
msItem.explicit: semper in corda mittendo

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Hom. euangelii
msItem.incipit: Cum intraret Ihesus in domum cuiusdam
Ydropis morbus ab aquoso humore
msItem.explicit: uetat congruit

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: In Marcum
msItem.incipit: Respondens unus de turba
Notandum est quod semper loca rebus
msItem.explicit: propulsabimus insidias

msItem.author: Gregory
msItem.title: Hom. in euangelia
msItem.incipit: Arborem fici habebat
Dominus et redemptor noster per euangelium suum aliquando uerbis loquitur
msItem.explicit: transeuntes lacrimas gaudia mansura, per dominum nostrum Ihesum

msItem.author: Ps.-John Chrysostom
msItem.title: Opus imperfectum in Matthaeum
msItem.incipit: Accesserunt ad Ihesum Pharisei
msItem.rubric: Omelia beati Iohannis episcopi de eadem lectione
msItem.incipit: Convenerunt ergo Pharisei ut multitudine
msItem.explicit: melius cognoscens eum per ipsum

msItem.author: Petrus Chrysologus
msItem.title: Serm. 50
msItem.incipit: Ascendens Ihesus in nauiculam
msItem.rubric: Omelia beati Iohannis episcopi de eadem lectione
msItem.incipit: Christum in humanis actibus
msItem.explicit: perfidię iam moreris

msItem.author: Gregory
msItem.title: Hom. in evangelia
msItem.incipit: Simile factum est regnum
Textum lectionis ęuangelicę fratres karissimi uolo sub breutitate transcurrere
msItem.explicit: assumere naturam nostram qui uiuit et regnat

msItem.author: Gregory
msItem.title: Hom. in evangelia
msItem.incipit: Erat quidam regulus
Lectio sancti euangelii quam modo fratres audistis expositione non indiget, sed ne hanc tacite preterisse uideamur
msItem.explicit: per fidem tenetis per dominum nostrum Ihesum Christum qui uiuit

msItem.incipit: Simile factum est regnum
Familiare est Syris et maxime
msItem.explicit: hostia ipsi fuerimus
msItem.note: PD II.94a-b, a confection of Jerome, In euangelium Matthaei III.18.23-5 and Gregory, Dialogues, IV.60-2.

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: In Lucam
msItem.incipit: Abeuntes Pharisei
Et obseruantes Pharisei miserunt
msItem.explicit: non inuenisset locum

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: In Lucam
msItem.incipit: Loquente Ihesu ad turbas ecce princeps
Ecce uir uenit cui nomen erat Iairus Priori lectione quam de abiectione
msItem.explicit: peccatoris inpinguet caput eorum
msItem.note: The remainder of fol. 115 cut away; the verso blank.

supportDesc.support: Parchment; some original flaws with medieval repairs

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in plummet for two columns of 28–30 lines. Ruled space c. 270–5 205–10 Written above top line.

handDesc.handNote: Protogothic bookhands, by more than one scribe (e.g. there is a change in the second column of fol. 2r).

decoDesc.decoNote: One fine pen-drawn zoomorphic initial in the form of a dragon sprouting foliage, reserved against a red ground (fol. 35r); other initials with lesser decoration in plain red, sometimes effusively embellished (e.g. fol. 45v, 78r).

msContents.summary: Supplementary homilies for Easter to the fifth week after Pentecost, for the dedication of a church, and for Christmas to Epiphany.

msItem.author: Eusebius Gallicanus
msItem.title: Hom. 13-17 de Pascha
msItem.rubric: Sermones de resurrectione domini quorum primus videlicet exulta superius [fol. 15v] infra omelias habetur

msItem.title: Hom. 13
msItem.incipit: Beneficia dei nostri cum magna atque mirifica sint
msItem.explicit: non dubitent reparatos

msItem.title: Hom. 14
msItem.incipit: Magnum et mirabile paschalis baptismi sacramentum
msItem.explicit: respiciant iam redempti

msItem.title: Hom. 15
msItem.incipit: Hodierne diei sacrosancta sollempnitas Hebraice phasę
msItem.explicit: rebellium transeat angelorum

msItem.title: Hom. 16
msItem.incipit: Oportune et congrue sub die insigni sollempnitatis hodiernę
msItem.explicit: pro alapsis suis

msItem.title: Hom. 17
msItem.incipit: Magnitudo cęlestium beneficiorum angustias humanę mentis excedit
msItem.explicit: nescit distributione consumi

msItem.author: (Ps.-)Maximus of Turin
msItem.title: Hom. 90
msItem.rubric: Sermo Maximi episcopi in maiori letania
msItem.incipit: Legimus in prophetis cum Ninive civitati subversio divinitus immineret
msItem.explicit: superare possimus

msItem.rubric: In ascensione domini sermo Leonis papę
msItem.incipit: Post beatam et gloriosam resurrectionem domini nostri
msItem.explicit: dexteram collocauit, qui

msItem.incipit: Sacramentum dilectissimi salutis nostrę
msItem.explicit: possimus ascendere, cui est cum patre

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilia in I Regum (De Helcana)
msItem.rubric: Dominica prima post Pentecosten sermo Origenis
msItem.incipit: Historia nobis recitata est de primo libro regnorum
msItem.explicit: suscitauit ut in nouitate uitę ambulem in Christo Ihesu domino nostro

msItem.title: Seven sermons attributed to St Augustine

msItem.author: Caesarius of Arles
msItem.title: Sermo 121
msItem.rubric: Sermo beati Augustini episcopi de David et patre eius Ysai
msItem.incipit: In scripturis divinis fratres karissimi. hec eademque persona
msItem.explicit: feliciter uenire mereamur, quod ipse dominus noster prestare dignetur qui

msItem.author: Caesarius of Arles
msItem.title: Sermo 183
msItem.rubric: De divite cuius ager uberes fructus attulit, et de divite qui induebatur purpura et bisso. Sermo sancti Augustini episcopi
msItem.incipit: Si diligenter adtenditis fratres karissimi omnes sacerdotes domini non solum episcopos sed etiam presbiteros
msItem.explicit: ad ęterna premia feliciter peruenire, prestante domini nostro, cui est

msItem.author: Caesarius of Arles
msItem.title: Sermo 122
msItem.rubric: Dominica .II. Sermo beati Augustini episcopi de plaga dei
msItem.incipit: Cum Regum lectio legeretur audivimus
msItem.explicit: habitatorem habere mereamur, prestante eodem domino

msItem.author: Caesarius of Arles
msItem.title: Sermo 123
msItem.rubric: Alius sermo beati Augustini episcopi de iudicio Salomonis et duabus meretricibus
msItem.incipit: De duabus meretricibus dilectissimi fratres que adiucium ad iudicium Salemonis venerunt
msItem.explicit: iungere et conseruare dignetur, prestante eodem unigenito domino nostro

msItem.author: Caesarius of Arles
msItem.title: Sermo 124
msItem.rubric: Dominica .III. sermo beati Augustini episcopi de beato Helia
msItem.incipit: In lectionibus que nobis diebus istis rectantur fratres karissimi frequenter admonui
msItem.explicit: in ore sapientis, regnante ipso domino

msItem.author: Claudius of Turin
msItem.title: Quaestiones XXX super libros Regum
msItem.incipit: Videamus fratre karissimi quomodo David Christum prophetice signaverit
msItem.explicit: quam credentium Iudeorum

msItem.author: Caesarius of Arles
msItem.title: Sermo 127
msItem.rubric: Dominica .IIII. Sermo beati Augustini episcopi de Eliseo
msItem.incipit: Cum divina lectio legeretur audivimus quod cum pretereunte beato Heliseo pueri irridentes clamaverunt
msItem.explicit: consorcium regni mei, ad quod regnum nos pietas diuina perducere dignetur, qui

msItem.title: Sermo 89
msItem.rubric: Feria .IIII. VII mensis sermo Leonis pape
msItem.incipit: Predicationem nostram dilectissimi familiaris vobis adiuvat consuetudo
msItem.explicit: placatus exaudiat per Christum dominum nostrum

msItem.title: Sermo 90
msItem.incipit: Sacratum dilectissimi in septimo mense ieiunium
msItem.explicit: consequamur affectum, per dominum Ihesum Christum qui

msItem.title: Sermo 92
msItem.rubric: Sabbato sermo Leonis pape de eodem
msItem.incipit: Apostolica institucio dilectissimi dominum Ihesum Christum
msItem.explicit: donetur et posse, per dominum nostrum

msItem.title: Three sermons for the Dedication of a church or altar

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Serm. 15
msItem.rubric: Sermo Augustini episcopi in dedicatione ecclesię
msItem.incipit: Decorem domus domini locum tabernaculi claritatis eius diligimus [cf. Ps. 25.8] si et nos ipsi sumus. Quis ergo decor est domus dei
msItem.explicit: ibi est decor domus dei qui uiuit

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: Serm. 230
msItem.rubric: Sermo Augustini in dedicatione ecclesie vel templi
msItem.incipit: Sicut optime novit sanctitas vestra, consecrationem altaris hodie celebramus
msItem.explicit: nutriat in se ignem, quem in eo dignetur ascendere

msItem.author: Eusebius Gallicanus
msItem.title: Hom. 49 in dedicatione ecclesiae
msItem.rubric: Sermo Leonis papae in dedicatione ecclesię
msItem.incipit: Beatos apostolos sermo divinus sub apellatione commemorat montium pro stabilitate virtutum
msItem.explicit: non uult excludi ipse qui uiuit

msItem.author: Leo Magnus
msItem.title: Serm. 26
msItem.incipit: Omnibus quidem diebus dilectissimi atque temporibus animis fidelium divina meditancium
msItem.explicit: hii filii dei sunt, qui regnat cum filio

msItem.author: Ps.-Maximus of Turin
msItem.title: Sermo 10, de natiuitate Domini V
msItem.rubric: Sermo beati Augustini episcopi unde supra
msItem.incipit: Hodie fratres karissimi Christus natus est nos renati. Hodie salvator mundi per matrem nascendi tempus accepit
msItem.explicit: inoffensam cęlestis fidei ueritatem

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: Serm. 122
msItem.rubric: Item sermo sancti Maximini unde supra
msItem.incipit: In adventu dominico fratres karissimi solutus est omnis paternę prevaricationis metus
msItem.explicit: iniquitate purgaret

msItem.author: Ps.-Maximus of Turin
msItem.title: Sermo 13
msItem.incipit: Hodierni misterii sacramentum fratres karissimi sicut credidistis semper et creditis
msItem.explicit: dubitare non possis

msItem.title: Three sermons for the feast of St Stephen (26 December)

msItem.author: Ps.-Maximus of Turin
msItem.title: Sermo 85
msItem.incipit: Hesterno die natalem habuimus domini salvatoris
msItem.explicit: palmam martyrii consequitur coronam

msItem.incipit: Donet mihi dominus dicere salubriter qui donavit Stephano tanta dicere
msItem.explicit: in domino glorietur cum quo uiuit
msItem.note: Alan of Farfa I.22, a confection of Augustine, serm. 319, and Ps.-Augustine, serm. 122

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Serm. 314
msItem.incipit: Natalem domini hesterna die celebravimus natalem servi hodie celebramus
msItem.explicit: desiderat coronari

msItem.title: Two sermons for the feast of the Holy Innocents (28 December)

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: Serm. 218
msItem.incipit: Christo igitur secundum prophetię fidem nato in Bethleem Iudę temporibus Herodis
msItem.explicit: credulitate querendus est

msItem.author: Ps.-Maximus of Turin
msItem.title: Sermo 78
msItem.incipit: Quocienscumque fratres karissimi sanctorum martyria celebramus
msItem.explicit: cęlestibus honoratur

msItem.author: Leo Magnus
msItem.title: Serm. 36
msItem.rubric: Sermo Leonis pape de epiphania domini
msItem.incipit: Dies dilectissimi quo primum gentibus salvator mundi apparuit
msItem.explicit: serit discordias. ascendit iras. incitat lin

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in plummet for two columns of 30 lines. Ruled space c. 270 205 Written above top line.

decoDesc.decoNote: Initials in plain red with simple arabesque decoration

msItem.title: Readings added on a previously blank flyleaf for the feast of St Peter’s Chains (1 August), and Holy Saturday

msItem.rubric: Isti lectiones leguntur Rome in ad vinculi sancti Petri apostoli
msItem.incipit: Notandum est fratres karissimi qua de causa celebratui festivitas sancti Petri que dicitur ad vincula kalendis Augusti. Hec ergo a quibusdam dicitur causa
msItem.explicit: sed illi me tibi cuius sum unigenitus indicavit [two? more words uncertain]

msItem.incipit: Vespere autem sabbati … [Matthew 28:1] Vigiliam huius sacratissime noctis sicut ex lectione ewangelica audistis fratres karissimi. Resurrectio domini ac salvatoris nostri dedicavit
msItem.explicit: deinceps anime superno gaudio sine fine fruantur.

layoutDesc.layout: Recto: 2 columns of up to 32 lines; verso: a single column of 27 lines, the last few squeezed into a limited space. Ruled space (fol. 1r) c. 290 205

handDesc.handNote: Recto: Proto-gothic bookhand; verso: a different proto-gothic bookhand

decoDesc.decoNote: Recto: Two- and one-line initials in red and green.
Verso: a few embellished initials, in plain brown ink.

revisionDesc.change: Description fully revised for Polonsky German digitization project.
Andrew Dunning Revised with Peter Kidd description.
James Cummings Up-converted the markup using https://github.com/jamescummings/Bodleian-msDesc-ODD/blob/master/convertTolkien2Bodley.xsl
